bib.title: Workshop on Social Influence--SI 2014-Introduction
bib.author: Michalski, Rados{\l}aw and Shakarian, Paulo and Scholtes, Ingo and Jankowski, Jaros{\l}aw
bib.abstract: The enormous popularity of the Internet and the evolution of social media create new areas for observing and modelling processes related to social sciences, such as social influence or diffusion of innovations. Now it is possible to evaluate different strategies of targeting people and observing the outcome of the process, since social graphs and social activity logs are definitely easier to obtain than two decades before. In this area several interesting topics can be distinguished, such as modelling the spread of influence, implementing and
